name: Juvenile Komodo Dragon
description:
Common Name: Komodo Dragon
Latin Name: Varanus komodoensis
Location: Indonesian islands of Komodo, Rinca, Nusa Kode, Gili Motang, and Flores.
Conservation Status: Endangered

Komodo dragons are the largest living lizard, with the largest ever recorded at 10.3 feet long and 365 pounds. 

When first hatched they weigh less than 3.5 ounces and average 16 inches in length. Young dragons spend the first few years of their lives living in trees until they become too heavy to climb. 

In 2009 a research study used a medical scanner to confirm that komodo dragons actually have venom glands in their lower jaws. 

Photographed at Denver Zoo
Nikon D5300
